page.title: 17THE ARTS IN ORKNEY
page.content: The Arts have a long tradition in Orkney, stretching back to the{Vikings and beyond. At{Maeshowe}_a prehistoric tomb_were found carved on the walls the largest collection of{runes}in the world and a beautiful{dragon. This Maeshowe dragon together with other{Viking,Pictish and Early {Christian designs}found in Orkney are used as the basis for local{jewellery. Orkney's most famous{artist}was {Dr.Stanley Cursiter,}the Queen's Limner in Scotland. { Opera,Drama}and all varieties of {music}come together at the{St.Magnus {Festival}which often features works by {Peter Maxwell Davies},Orkney's adopted composer.{Traditional music}is also very much alive. Orkney's best known{writers}are{Eric {Linklater,George Mackay Brown}and {Edwin Muir.
